questions.question_text:
A developer creates an Integration Procedure with a Set Values and a DataRaptor Extract Action that requires AccountId as a key. When the developer previews the Integration Procedure, the developer enters the AccountId correctly and executes the preview. The developer sees the data extracted by the DataRaptor in the Debug Log, but the response is empty.
What is the likely cause of this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer .

Selected Answer: B
B is the obvious answer

Selected Answer: B
It is B.
Not A. Because, why should the response not be displayed?
Not C. Because in the Debug Log of the data raptor is content
Not D. Because such a checkbox does not exist

comments.content: But d did not mention a check box in the answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
For me, the correct is:
B. A Response Action was not added to the Integration Procedure.

Selected Answer: D
If a developer creates an Integration Procedure with a Set Values and a DataRaptor Extract Action that requires an AccountId as a key, enters the AccountId correctly and executes the preview, and sees the data extracted by the DataRaptor in the Debug Log but the response is empty, the likely cause of this issue is:

D. The DataRaptor Action did not have the Add Response To Response JSON property set to true.
Options A and B are not correct, as the response can be previewed directly and a Response Action is not required to see the response in the preview.

choices.A: The Response cannot be previewed directly.
choices.D: The DataRaptor Action did not have the Add Response To Response JSON property set to true.
choices.B: A Response Action was not added to the Integration Procedure.
choices.C: The AccountId used for the preview is Invalid.

questions.question_text:
A developer creates an OmniScript to display FirstName, LastName, and BirthDate of a contact using a Type Ahead Block. The DataRaptor used in the Type Ahead has been tested and fetches the correct data.
When previewing the OmniScript, the developer enters a name in the Type Ahead and makes a selection of a contact from the list. However, the text fields FirstName, LastName. and BirthDate are not getting populated with the data.
Refer to the exhibit below.
//IMG//

What is the reason that the fields fail to display the fetched data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Based on the exhibit provided, the reason that the fields fail to display the fetched data is most likely D. FirstName, LastName, and BirthDate are not placed inside the Type Ahead Block.

The exhibit shows that the text fields FirstName, LastName, and BirthDate are placed outside the Type Ahead Block, while the DataRaptor is set to fetch data for the Type Ahead Block. Therefore, when a contact is selected from the Type Ahead list, the data is fetched correctly but not displayed in the text fields because they are not located within the Type Ahead Block.

To fix this issue, the developer should move the text fields FirstName, LastName, and BirthDate inside the Type Ahead Block. This will allow the fetched data to be displayed in the appropriate fields when a contact is selected from the Type Ahead list.

choices.A: Use Data JSON is not selected in the properties of the Type Ahead Block.
choices.B: The Typeahead Key is not in the correct format.
choices.C: Lookup Mode is not selected in the properties of the Type Ahead Block.
choices.D: FirstName, LastName, and BirthDate are not placed inside the Type Ahead Block.

choices.B: Delete or deactivate the Set Values element.
choices.C: Update the ContextId value to specify an id from the production org.
choices.D: Add a Show/Hide condition on the Set Values element.

questions.question_text:
A developer builds a new OmniScript. It contains a Set Values element with a ContextId key/value pair that was used during testing.
What should the developer do before moving the OmniScript to a production org?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This expeciffication is not clear for me.

As pprmey told IF this OmniSript was be buit to show Only the same record, them the right answer would be C. But let's thing a bit ....She parametes from SetValues is exatally ContextId , so it seems to me that the Omni will be built to be use in a record Page and the programer just create the SetValues to make test a bit faster, inteast of using Context Id on Simulate page. 

So I guess B !

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B. No debugging stuff in production
Answer is B - Know when testing an IP you could use "Set Values" element but always make sure to deactivate or delete it when promoting to PROD
Answer is B. Best practice question: it said it is used for testing. We don't test on prod. So Deactivate/Delete

comments.content: You should not trust all ChatGPT responses.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
If a developer builds a new OmniScript that contains a Set Values element with a ContextId key/value pair that was used during testing and needs to move it to a production org, the developer should:
C. Update the ContextId value to specify an id from the production org.
The ContextId key/value pair in the Set Values element is used to specify the context record for the OmniScript. This record is used to control the access and visibility of data in the OmniScript, as well as to provide context for any actions that update or retrieve data from Salesforce. Before moving the OmniScript to a production org, the developer should update the ContextId value to specify an id from the production org. This will ensure that the OmniScript is using the correct context record and is accessing the correct data in the production org.
Option B is not the best choice because deleting or deactivating the Set Values element would remove the context record from the OmniScript, which would cause it to fail in production.

questions.question_text:
A developer has a requirement to create a child FlexCard that contains all of its parent FlexCardâ€™s records in a Datatable
How should the developer configure the parent FlexCard's Data Node?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answers is C
Answer must be B. Question says troubleshoot of dataraptor extract.

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B
B is the right answer. You are troibleshootig data raptor not flexcard/omniscript.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B

Selected Answer: A
A. Deactivate the card and layout, and go to the PREVIEW tab for the card to test.
When troubleshooting a DataRaptor Extract, the first step should be to deactivate the card and layout and go to the PREVIEW tab for the card to test. This will allow the developer to see if the DataRaptor is retrieving data and what that data looks like. From there, the developer can make any necessary changes to the DataRaptor or the OmniScript itself to ensure that it is working as expected.

choices.A: Deactivate the card and layout, and go to the PREVIEW tab for the card to test.
choices.B: Add a key/value pair in the DataRaptor to test it.
choices.C: Go to the PREVIEW tab in OmniScript to test.
choices.D: Go to the Lightning Console and reload the page to test.

questions.question_text: What should a developer's first step be when troubleshooting whether a DataRaptor Extract is retrieving data?
